name: Overview
data:
[{"id":"5da13f49-5bf5-4707-b45e-da92ed3f40c1","type":"heading","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left","level":3,"isToggleable":false},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Group: Definition Lifecycle & CRUD","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"d92a5c40-2597-4160-b6dd-6f6a9ec5582c","type":"paragraph","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"This group of methods within the ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"DefinitionManager","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" handles the fundamental "Create, Read, Update, and Delete" (CRUD) operations for the global symbol table. These functions ensure that every identified code entity is uniquely registered, safely stored, and easily accessible. By centralizing the creation of ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"Definition","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" objects, the manager maintains the structural integrity of the analysis model.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"e67829c3-c183-4ce6-9c6c-83183eedd7be","type":"divider","props":{},"children":[]},{"id":"936d2a75-97d5-44ba-b808-b8bf6466be14","type":"heading","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left","level":4,"isToggleable":false},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Methods","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"c2852eeb-88ad-4c97-bf42-0557e3105261","type":"bulletListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"__init__()

","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":"Sets up the manager’s primary state. It initializes the ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"defs","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" dictionary, which acts as the main symbol table, and the ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"copyMap","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":", which tracks alias relationships.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"7902c425-aa84-454b-b1e8-abef73b246d4","type":"bulletListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"create(ns, def_type)

","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":"The standard way to register a new entity. It performs strict validation to ensure the namespace is a string and the type is valid. If the namespace is already registered, it raises an error to prevent the accidental overwriting of program logic.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"ad557ec9-4191-4519-b9b1-f6d5c99ae734","type":"bulletListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"create_by_name(dict_name, ns, def_type)

","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":"A specialized variation of ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"create","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":". It allows the definition to be stored in the registry under a different key (","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"dict_name","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":") while still maintaining its actual namespace (","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"ns","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":"). This is useful for handling complex scenarios where a single code entity might be referenced through multiple internal keys.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"0c0f1e22-cd46-47dd-882f-a330a43e4aae","type":"bulletListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"get(ns)

","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":"The primary lookup method. It returns the ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"Definition","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" object associated with the provided namespace, or ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"None","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" if the symbol has not been seen before.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"f1f76db4-c9b0-433a-85ec-6c155c433829","type":"bulletListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"addCopy(copyNs, ns)

","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":"Establishes a relationship between a copy (alias) and its original definition. It marks the copy definition with an ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"isCopy","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" flag and records the link in the ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"copyMap","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":", allowing the engine to trace values across aliased variables.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"5192d78e-8b11-437c-8fce-82cbc1f304ec","type":"bulletListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"getOrCreate(ns, def_type)

","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":"An idempotent helper method. It attempts to find a definition; if it fails, it creates a new one. This is frequently used by the analyzer to ensure a target exists before trying to assign it a value.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"789c2d39-ac76-4278-a19b-88a177785729","type":"bulletListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"get_defs()

","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":"Provides read access to the entire ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"defs","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" registry. This is primarily used for post-analysis reporting or for iterating over all symbols to propagate global values.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"a1965b8b-673b-4e3e-a0d5-c3995e5c8559","type":"divider","props":{},"children":[]},{"id":"215b0c0c-a1a1-401d-8e69-6d9b2134d53c","type":"heading","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left","level":3,"isToggleable":false},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Usage Example","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"5bec9a00-b55d-46a6-8609-31dd857ccb0c","type":"codeBlock","props":{"language":"python"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"from points import DefinitionManager
import utils

dm = DefinitionManager()

# 1. Create a variable in the 'main' scope
dm.create("main.user_count", utils.constants.NAME_DEF)

# 2. Use getOrCreate to safely access a dependency
# If 'main.db' doesn't exist, it is created now
db_defi = dm.getOrCreate("main.db", utils.constants.EXT_DEF)

# 3. Handle an alias (e.g., reference = user_count)
# Create the alias first
dm.create("main.reference", utils.constants.NAME_DEF)
# Record that 'reference' is a copy of 'user_count'
dm.addCopy("main.reference", "main.user_count")","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"8bd1b0f2-6478-4443-9a28-2d7954eadf27","type":"heading","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left","level":3,"isToggleable":false},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Insights","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"8330b9ce-b58f-43dc-956a-8679b0b7a604","type":"bulletListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Input Validation","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":": The ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"create","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" method includes strict checks for namespace types and valid definition categories, preventing malformed data from entering the symbol table.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"53f1dac3-3ade-4e40-873d-f25004f9be49","type":"bulletListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Alias Tracking","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":": The inclusion of ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"addCopy","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" and ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"copyMap","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" allows Jarvis to handle complex Python behaviors where multiple variables might point to the same underlying object definition.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"233e84a5-6492-4474-b35b-8f122eea7eca","type":"bulletListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Symbol Integrity","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":": By preventing duplicate creation via the ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"create","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" method, the system ensures that a function or variable has one single "source of truth" throughout the analysis.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"84da4053-e05a-4e20-b2bd-ae520c54a689","type":"paragraph","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[],"children":[]}]
